item.title: Our Father's Plan Is About Families
item.description: Elder Quentin L. Cook teaches the blessings that come to families as they discover their family history together.

item.title: Family History Blesses Families
item.description: Knowing your family history, learning about your ancestors, and serving them through temple ordinances brings blessings not only to them but also to the living.

item.title: Blessings to the Living through Family History
item.description: Elders L. Whitney Clayton, Allan F. Packer, and Kent F. Richards discuss the blessings that come to the living through temple and family history work.

item.title: Time Well Spent
item.description: A couple in England shares how doing family history work has enhanced their experiences in the temple. They show the application of a principle outlined by Elder Richard G. Scott that "any work you do in the temple is time well spent, but receiving ordinances vicariously for one of your own ancestors will make the time in the temple more sacred." To get started finding your family members needing temple saving ordinances, visit FamilySearch.org.

item.title: Musical Presentation: The Family Is of God
item.description: Three family ensembles sing “The Family Is of God.”

item.title: How We Live Our Religion - Veme
item.description: "How we live our religion is far more important than what we may say about our religion." —Robert D. Hales

item.title: The Path of Discipleship - Veme
item.description: "With the gift of God’s grace, the path of discipleship does not lead backward; it leads upward.” —Dieter F. Uchtdorf

item.title: The Wisdom of Him Who Knoweth All Things - Veme
item.description: “With prophets ancient and modern, I testify that ‘all things have been done in the wisdom of him who knoweth all things.’”—Jeffrey R. Holland

item.title: The Blessings of the Temple - Veme
item.description: "The blessings of the temple are priceless." —Thomas S. Monson

item.title: We Are on His Errand - Veme
item.description: "We are on His errand. Let us learn of Him. Let us follow in His footsteps. Let us live by His precepts." —Thomas S. Monson

item.title: A Consecrated Life - Veme
item.description: “Even the smallest act of discipleship or the tiniest ember of belief can become a blazing bonfire of a consecrated life.”—Dieter F. Uchtdorf

item.title: Balance Your Life - Veme
item.description: "Balance your life with spiritual experiences that remind and prepare you for continued, daily ministering to others."—M. Russell Ballard

item.title: Following His Light - Veme
item.description: "Following His light and example will bring us joy, happiness, and peace." —Quentin L. Cook

item.title: Essential Things - Veme
item.description: "Many things are good, many are important, but only a few are essential."—D. Todd Christofferson

item.title: Source of Enduring Peace - Veme
item.description: "Correct knowledge of and faith in the Lord empower us to hush our fears."—David A. Bednar

item.title: Spiritual Food - Veme
item.description: "Spiritual food is necessary for spiritual survival." —Dallin H. Oaks

item.title: The Plan of Happiness - Veme
item.description: "The greatest reward we have received in this life, and the life to come, is our children and grandchildren.” —Boyd K. Packer

item.title: Henry B. Eyring General Women's Session March 2015
item.description: We lighten the loads of others best by helping The Lord strengthen them

item.title: When Ye Are in the Service-YM
item.description: A young man in California experiences joy as he takes on the challenge to see how much service he can provide to those around him in 3 days.

item.title: When Ye Are in the Service-YW
item.description: Young Women in Japan experience joy as they take on the challenge to see how much service they can provide to those around them in 3 days.

item.title: Follow the Prophet
item.description: Carol F. McConkie, First Counselor in the Young Women’s Presidency, describes why God calls prophets. A group of youth discover the importance of listening to the right voices when charting their course.

item.title: Time Well Spent
item.description: A couple in England shares how doing family history work has enhanced their experiences in the temple. They show the application of a principle outlined by Elder Richard G. Scott that "any work you do in the temple is time well spent, but receiving ordinances vicariously for one of your own ancestors will make the time in the temple more sacred." To get started finding your family members needing temple saving ordinances, visit FamilySearch.org.
